text: With growing planet's population

and adverse weather events
that will just keep increasing,

I just felt very passionately
about trying to do our bit
to offer a solution.
Phytoform's mission is
to make agriculture more sustainable.

We do this by speeding up
the scientific discovery

and implementation process
into edible, sustainable food.

The core innovation is our
DNA discovery platform.

It allows us to discover
solutions to things like drought
or diseases and we get a sort of blueprint
to make plants hardier and better.
One of the programs we're running is
developing a drought-tolerant tomato

where we can make food
a little bit more secure
by making tomatoes grow with less water.
It is a game-changer
because it enables us to go from a problem
to a solution in less than two years.

As a startup, we don't have
dedicated cloud engineers
and cloud operations.

Instead, we leverage technical
help from AWS directly

to onboard a large AI
model onto the system.

Thanks to S3 transfer
tools, most of the data

that comes into our
model is already on AWS,
which is a huge help for us.

What we are offering is
more sustainable food,
food that did not create huge CO2 impact

that can be more nutritious
without pesticides

and a longer shelf life,
so it can be better
and healthier for the end user.
